CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1958, pg. 3, reads: "Their Home Blistered - The home of Mrs. Caroletha Williams and her five children was well blistered early Thursday morning when a fire gutted the building recently vacated, in front of her home. The lone telephone in Mrs. Williams' home served the four remaining stranded families, now living in gasless, condemned homes. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Children, possibly from Williams and Thomas families, some with hula hoops, outside of home with fire damage in Ingram Palace housing project, Ingram, Pennsylvania
